intro: Sonchoseris decora, commonly known as the showy dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single bloom. The plant features bright yellow ray flowers surrounded by a dense cluster of disk flowers, which are typically smaller and tubular. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Sonchoseris decora thrives in sunny, open habitats such as meadows and disturbed soils.
